review: This is all about thanking Mr.Rukshan for the exclusive service of you and your staff. I visited shore by o on a Friday it was so happening with a live band. Impressed on the way how they are following the covid rules. Food was amazing....Cocktails were so good. Thank you so very much. I am hoping to visit this weekend t Cocktails were so good. Thank you so very much. I am hoping to visit this weekend too.

95 / 100 minimum
What a lovely restaurant, good food and service and atmosphere, definitely hope to go back.üòçüòò
The worst place to have a lunch date. Really disappointed. Food was old and tasted terrible. The lime that was use to make the lime soda was years old.

Bought a Meat kottu, its taste terrible and clearly taste like ready made kottu pack from a supermarket. Don‚Äôt ever buy a Kottu from this place and it‚Äôs a disgrace for name ‚ÄúKOTTU‚Äù the way they have prepared it

Wow!awesome place nice food,awesome alcohol. Mahen and rukshan are the  best hosts in whole of sri lanka. Mahen specially made us feel at home and he is the absolute best. Mahen is an absolutely valuable asset to shore by O. I met him just today...and he took care of all of us (10 people) and I wish him all the best for the future. . Thank you so mu and he took care of all of us (10 people) and I wish him all the best for the future. . Thank you so much!

The staff were very friendly & helpful, good selection of drinks, ordered a mixed grilled meat platter which was quite average (side of mashed potatoes could improve), DJ definitely contributed in making the evening more enjoyable.
situated right on the beach , perfect place to party , went with my office colleagues, food is good..

great ambience for a party. small groups hangout. very good dj music. just by the beach. good food and good drinks. cocktails and Drinks served in good quantity. good for family outing during day or early evening.

Great music, great atmosphere, lit up on fairy lights, very friendly staff. First night in Sri Lanka, staying at the hotel opposite.
Ordered a lion beer and the local fresh crab curry, with rice and a coconut satay sambol. Was lush, nice amount of kick....And my partner said it was her best mojito of her trip, and shes been here three months, plenty of testing lol. 
Would recommend very much.
Jon and Clare from Cornwall And my partner said it was her best mojito of her trip, and shes been here three months, plenty of testing lol. 
Would recommend very much.
Jon and Clare from Cornwall UK

The only taste you could sense in the lobster was cheddar cheese. Such a waste. In addition We...ordered fries but were served rice. Our most expensive dinner in Sri Lanka was by far the worst.

Wow. Simply loved the food and cocktails. Also I can take my own bottle there. Uncommon food, bites were awesome. Nice chill out atmosphere with the sea in view. Will be going often, great job guys. Keep it up
Excellent food,music and ambience. Prices are affordable and portions are good.Will definitelyvudit again. Nice place to go with family.
Such a beautiful restaurant. Lovely music, ambience and fantastic food. Loved the pork chops and cheese omelette. Refreshing drinks too. Good place to chill out and wind down. Will be a regular

Fantastic new restaurant right on the beach. Food was excellent, delicious and good portions. Value for money. Atmosphere was excellent with live music today on other days nice soothing music. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Top of the notch cocktails. Overall superb experience. Will...definitely visit many tim definitely visit many times.

What a beautiful restaurant! We loved it! Such a relaxing atmosphere, romantic lights, candles and coversongs on the background. A view on the ocean. Clean tables. And a really kind service! Food was delicious as well, presented so nice!
Good job to Con Amor, you...guys are doing it well! Thanks for the great evening you gave us!
Kind regards
Destination Unknown, Gaetan & L guys are doing it well! Thanks for the great evening you gave us!
Kind regards
Destination Unknown, Gaetan & Lisa
Price is reasonable and it is thin crust and have different tastes..It takes little time to prepare.You can see the wood oven burning and the cooks working inside.Taste is very good.
I went to this outlet with some of my friends for dinner. The place is very clean and the service is very good. The staff are very friendly and the pizzas are simply delicious.
Just walked up and down Galle road about 10 times looking for this place to be told it‚Äôs no longer at the address on this page! Waste of our evening!

Harpos used to be one of the best places in the town with reliable food everytime we visit. This is not the case anymore though. At least not with Mount Lavinia branch. Everything was slow and delayed in an almost empty restaurant. The food was...ok,nothing extraordanry except for the dessert pizza. The tiramsu was dry and tasteless. Portions have become small and whether the high price we pay worth it,is questionable. My pasta had lot of artificial sauce and eventhough the taste was ok,I really didn't like it. We had to call for waiters and wait atleats for 5/10 minutes till someone shows up. Wish they will correct their mistakes and go back to be the legend they we ok,nothing extraordanry except for the dessert pizza. The tiramsu was dry and tasteless. Portions have become small and whether the high price we pay worth it,is questionable. My pasta had lot of artificial sauce and eventhough the taste was ok,I really didn't like it. We had to call for waiters and wait atleats for 5/10 minutes till someone shows up. Wish they will correct their mistakes and go back to be the legend they were.

The staff here was very friendly and they knew everything in the menu and thus could explain us what each and every dish where. I really do like the portion size. Pizza's sizes can be served in four sizes. The largest size is 64 inch,...if I am not mistaken. They would allow us to mix four varieties in one pizza. They even had salmon. They were a lot varieties. I would recommend this place to anyo if I am not mistaken. They would allow us to mix four varieties in one pizza. They even had salmon. They were a lot varieties. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I think this was the best pizza place that we visited in town so far. Pizza was cooked well and served hot. It was very delicious with natural flavors. Lots of pizza varieties could be found on  the menu too. Highly recommending this place to...any real pizza lovers in town any real pizza lovers in town !!

Came here with my family, food was really good. Their pizza was very good and is worth trying. The pasta is also great. Quite expensive compared to most restaurants but the food is high quality and doesn't disappoint so it's worth the money. Service was...good, Friendly staff and the food didn't take too long to arrive. Good ambiance and Average d√©cor. Good for groups. Definitely worth going to and trying their piz good, Friendly staff and the food didn't take too long to arrive. Good ambiance and Average d√©cor. Good for groups. Definitely worth going to and trying their pizza!

We went there for dinner and the staff was helpful in selecting from the menu. They had the widest choice in terms of sizes and variety.  They had pork which I have not seen in international Pizza chains. The staff was friendly and helpful and...even advised us when we order large Pizza we could get them to have one half in one topping and the other with a different topping. The speciality is the thin crust base baked using firewood which we could also see from the count even advised us when we order large Pizza we could get them to have one half in one topping and the other with a different topping. The speciality is the thin crust base baked using firewood which we could also see from the counter.

This is probably the best low cost Italian restaurant I have been anywhere.  I am not a pizza guy so I had the pasta.  It was so tasty that I ordered from here the next day for lunch.  My coworkers agreed so they also had...Harpo's with me. 
Most Sri Lankan food is highly tastey and this place ranks among the be Harpo's with me. 
Most Sri Lankan food is highly tastey and this place ranks among the best.

All the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant , our time at Harpo's was made 
 even more enjoyable by Chathuranga Fernando, who took the time to talk to us individually.
This place offered the best tasting pizza we‚Äôve yet tasted. Loved the thin crust and the really flavorful topping. Service was superb. An amazing service.

I am a huge fan of thin crust pizza and and I absolutely love Harpo's. They really do the crust well. The filling and the taste is also really good. I mostly order delivery and the service has been great.
Superb pizza. Thin crust. Way better than its competitors. Good selection. Good ambience. Excellent service.

The food was great just like any of Harpos restaurants.
Service too was very good, special mention of Mr Indrajith who served us, was  Very courteous & very patient as we had a big group.
The Tagliollini Frutti di mare a pasta dish was the...best.
The desserts were very good, but the  Cheese cake was too hard,  the taste was good, it was more like a hard jelly.Needs improvement.
All in all it was a great place to have a me best.
The desserts were very good, but the  Cheese cake was too hard,  the taste was good, it was more like a hard jelly.Needs improvement.
All in all it was a great place to have a meal.
this place has very good pizza and the overall service of the restaurant is very good. they do have a good selection of pizza and  pasta

Great place that does pizza and pasta very well. Pizza is made using a wood fired oven that gives it a really authentic Italian taste. Recommend the Margarita pizza and Amatricana pasta, no frills just good ingredients. Service is polite and attentive. A bit out...of the way but worth making the effort to vis of the way but worth making the effort to visit.

If you want a change from local food, the pizzas here were excellent. Service was good, with very friendly staff. Restaurant was cool, clean and comfortable. 
Recommended. :)
We had a hearty breakfast at Olivia. The food was good and the service was nice. They served the regular dishes (including omelette and fruits) for breakfast.

Delicious food, staff were very friendly and super nice atmosphere. Plus it‚Äôs all at an affordable price.
Can totally recommended this restaurant and will definitely come back again.

Excellent food and the Customer Service.Enjoyed the 
Delicious Pizza and the Pasta with Clove flour garlic bread bowl.
Love the sea food Pitza and curried chicken pasta..serving of the pasta on a bread bowl was something unique . Can‚Äôt forget the yummy blueberry cheesecake
Enjoyed their well prepared Authentic Italian pasta. Excellent, friendly and curtious  service. Blueberry Cheese  cake was super delicious

Without any hesitation highly recommended for a casual dine in besides the beach on Mt
Lavinia.

Italian cuisine specially their humongous crispy chicken creamy pasta on a mega bun. Wow out of this world
Fantastic food. Very tasty sea food pizza and calamari. The pasta is a must try, one of the best in Colombo. Would highly recommend this Italian restaurant.
Friendly and accommodating staff . Food was very delicious  specially the variety of pizza they offer with other foodstuffs

I was there few days ago and this is the best Italian food I have had in Sri Lanka. Whole place has a Italian architecture . I also tried their Nasi Gurang rice and it was so delicious. Staff was very friendly and manager came...to us and gave us some complimentary dishes to try to try on and they were all so delicious. Highly recommend for anyone looking for great food and experie to us and gave us some complimentary dishes to try to try on and they were all so delicious. Highly recommend for anyone looking for great food and experience
It was a great experience I had in the Olivia restaurant. Delicious food and great service, and I highly recommend you to check out the place if you're into Italian food.

Roo's Deli ... The best place to order quality Italian /western dishes. it was indeed my savior for the Christmas Eve dinner I hosted, All the dishes tasted so good..  from lamb chops to honey glazed pork ribs, whole roast chicken with a homemade gravy..., garlic prawns, the creamy spicy mushroom pie, oven roasted creamy cheesy veg and the crispy garlic bread was out of this world, generous portions 
 and quality ingredients used with a touch of love, clearly made all the dishes  super tasty and value for money. 

There is no other happiness than hearing your guests repeating how delicious  the food and inquiring who prepared them. It was perfectly packed and was delivered on time as promised.
Thank you Ros De , garlic prawns, the creamy spicy mushroom pie, oven roasted creamy cheesy veg and the crispy garlic bread was out of this world, generous portions 
 and quality ingredients used with a touch of love, clearly made all the dishes  super tasty and value for money. 

There is no other happiness than hearing your guests repeating how delicious  the food and inquiring who prepared them. It was perfectly packed and was delivered on time as promised.
Thank you Ros Deli.

Had THE BEST Lamprais today from Roo's Deli and I was frankly mind-blown!

Being someone that eats rice three times a day and being a huge foodie, I am extra critical about my food especially the rice based meals! My Chicken Lamprais today was just...off the charts and probably the best I've had!!

Firstly, it arrived in under 35 minutes, hot as ever almost as if it had just been cooked and sent to me right away. Secondly, there were so many different items offered with the rice which were so unique in preparation and flavour! A taste I've never experienced before! Thirdly, the portion was huge! I usually eat a lot and finish a big packet of rice all by myself but I struggled to finish this one as they were so generous with the quantity! Too generous!

I would give their Chicken Lamprais a 10/10 without batting an eyelid because it is every foodie's dream! Especially if you love rice! Thank you again Roo's Deli for giving me one of the most satisfying meals I have had in a while!! Definitely going to be one of your loyal customers and looking forward to ordering from you again very so off the charts and probably the best I've had!!

Thank you again Roo's Deli for giving me one of the most satisfying meals I have had in a while!! Definitely going to be one of your loyal customers and looking forward to ordering from you again very soon!
Delicious high quality food, Tried the big submarine, Burger and the Crispy Chicken Meals. Everything was de-li-cious. Best Burger in Town! Highly recommended

Last week we ordered through Pickme and everything was more than we expected...

food Fresh potato chips with crispy fish and chips with garlic bread ;) ... we loved it. it was a complete meal with fresh salad....Value for  money.

Kids enjoyed their Creamy penne...pes pesto.

Awesome place in my. lavinia beach.And arrangement are good.helpful staff was there.who recommending name of danushka.but the they not allowing to bring the even water bottle.also price is very unfair And management have to reschedule the operation.thank you again to danushka.we had good experience and...good service  with him atlea good service  with him atleast.
I had a nice seafood meal and that was amazing, thank you so much, if you looking for a place at Mount lavinia for a nice seafood, this is the best place.

We went for dinner on 30th December 2020 after having a time at Mt.beach. Ordered seafood fried rice, deviled shrimp and kankung dish. Taste of food is average, the seafood they've used, seemed not fresh. But we got a big portion in every dish. Cleanliness...is not satisfactory.  There wasn't any soap or detergent at the wash basin at the entrance and tap was somewhat broken too. They didn't clean tables prior to dine  is not satisfactory.  There wasn't any soap or detergent at the wash basin at the entrance and tap was somewhat broken too. They didn't clean tables prior to dine in.

Last Christmas evening our family (a family of three) went for a dinner out at Loon Tao ‚Äì Mt. Lavinia. We have visited this place several times, but this time we went after a fairly long break. As soon as we entered the place got...to know it was under a new management. 
We were very happy with the service and food. The ambience was great as usual. We were pleased with the whole set up. Food was very well prepared and there was a wide variety of choices. Quantity of a portion was worth for money. Above all service was quick and all the tables were well looked after. 
Mr. Lahiru our host was excellent. He was very helpful and provided us with an efficient superb service. My special thank goes to him because he went out of the way to make us comfortable in every possible way. Assistant Manager Mr. Mahen was actively engaged in a good job to ensure all the customers had a wonderful experience. 
One of the best places for romantic dinner with live music.
Best wishes for the new management! We will visit again for su to know it was under a new management.

Nice place by the sea. Food was delicious and the waiter pasindu was friendly and offered a quality service.

Ate here each night of our 3 night stay in Mount Lavinia. Just as good as we remembered from 2016.
Great staff, great food and reasonable priced wine and beer. Devilled cuttlefish was particularly good. One night there was a private party and when it...rained at the end of our meal the host invited us in. So even the customers were love rained at the end of our meal the host invited us in. So even the customers were lovely.

Ordered a pepper pork which was super tasty, ideal place to chill with a beer and of course the stunning view of the ocean, friendly staff, The building seems a bit rundown and with a little bit of renovation JoJo‚Äôs could offer quite a compelling...produ product.
the shack provide beach bed , beach table , changing room , drinks on economical rate . excellent service with clean seating arrangement

A Tuk Tuk driver took me to this place. He highly recommended this place, later I realised he was right. Fresh seafood specially marinated fish with local spices, jumbo prawns were superb. Had beers right on the nice beach enjoying the sunset, it was a...really chilling memorable experience. price was reasonable. Staff was really friendly and ready to serve you at anytime. Be careful about the rail tracks next to the restaurant specially when you get drunk. Thanks JoJo's pl really chilling memorable experience. price was reasonable. Staff was really friendly and ready to serve you at anytime. Be careful about the rail tracks next to the restaurant specially when you get drunk. Thanks JoJo's place

Basic but nicely located with tables right on the beach. The menu is well priced and includes a range of noodle and rice dishes plus a smattering of western offerings. Portions are very large and one dish will do two people. We took chicken chop...sues and rice and it was very well cooked.  Good place for grabbing lunch on the bea sues and rice and it was very well cooked.  Good place for grabbing lunch on the beach.

if you want to just go and chill, sip on a cold brew or even take your prefered spirits (the hard types), then I'd say this is the best laid-back place on Mount Beach. 

But don't just go for the cold brew... or to savour...your favourite spirits that you'd like to take with you. Go through their menu and you'll find quite a variety to sink your teeth into, or to satisfy your cravings for a nice and spicy 'bite'. If you're Sri Lankan, you know how important 'bites' are, and the immeasurable role it plays in complementing our drinking :-)... If you are one of those bite-people, Jo Jo's is the place on the beach... (I mean if you really know and love your bites).

It's not to say that their choice of mains (if I may call it so) are poor, they are a league of their own. We all know what a good Chinese-Sri Lankan style Chop Suey is... these guys have gone one step further and given it a more flavourful spin (at least that is what 'Z' (Z is one of the partners... who knows his food) told me one evening. I do agree that they've added a little magic of their own, to this ever-popular Chinese 'rice'. But that's not all. They've got more. 

The good thing is, when you give your order, tell one of the boya taking the order how you want your spice and they'll do the best with your request. The batter fried stuff are quite crunchy and they spicy stuff are just fiery in a kind of tantalising way. 

By the way, it doesn't mean Jo Jo's is only for the guys & gals who want to sip a brew or down a few shots. It's also a charming setting, to just go out for a chilled out dinner with someone close or your family. 

Next time you hit Mount beach, not visiting Jo Jo's would be such a was your favourite spirits that you'd like to take with you. The staff is very friendly and the Kottu was very good. Even though it‚Äôs right next to the beach, the prices are very reasonable.
Visited JoJo‚Äôs Place for dinner on the weekend. Their food was super delicious. And the portions were large and enough for 2. Highly recommend this Jem on Mount Lavinia beach.

My dinner was very nice. The soup and prawns were delicious and a very generous portion of everything. The staff is very friendly. Fast service. Great view on the beach. Good prices. Really recommend!

Since I was last here, the cheap beach places have all gone, together with some of the expensive ones, leaving mostly mid-range. JoJo‚Äôs is typical of these, pleasant enough but nothing to get excited about. All these places have identikit menus, the usual fish, chicken,...beef and squid dishes for around 700LKR. Some of them then ramp up the cost by charging up to 450 for a portion of steamed rice, all have sky-high beer prices (often not listed on the menu) and all add 10%, so the final bill can turn out a bit more than you were expecting.

At Jojo‚Äôs the food is OK, the generous portion of rice moderately priced and the beer as overpriced as everywhere else. In the evening they ruin the tranquil atmosphere, sound of waves, etc. by playing a local radio station at high volume so you get random music or, half the time, someone talking. Service was pretty quick when I was there, but I was the only diner ‚Äì there seems a general lack of punters in this area nowadays.

I wouldn‚Äôt particularly recommend eating on Lavinia Beach at all, but if you want to, JoJos is as good as the various more expensive places listed on TA. If you can't find somewhere quieter, it‚Äôs not a bad choice. If you can, the quality will likely be about the sam beef and squid dishes for around 700LKR. Some of them then ramp up the cost by charging up to 450 for a portion of steamed rice, all have sky-high beer prices (often not listed on the menu) and all add 10%, so the final bill can turn out a bit more than you were expecting.

At Jojo‚Äôs the food is OK, the generous portion of rice moderately priced and the beer as overpriced as everywhere else. In the evening they ruin the tranquil atmosphere, sound of waves, etc. by playing a local radio station at high volume so you get random music or, half the time, someone talking. Service was pretty quick when I was there, but I was the only diner ‚Äì there seems a general lack of punters in this area nowadays.

I wouldn‚Äôt particularly recommend eating on Lavinia Beach at all, but if you want to, JoJos is as good as the various more expensive places listed on TA. If you can't find somewhere quieter, it‚Äôs not a bad choice. If you can, the quality will likely be about the same..
Simple but good and affordable stay directly at the sea, straight from Blue Seas GH. Great upper dininghall too viewing over the ocean.

We found JoJo's while walking along the beach. Good food, friendly staff and nice ocean view. I told the waiter I wanted my food EXTRA SPICY. He went back and told the cook and they made it spicy. Boy, did they make it spicy. It...was aweso was awesome.

We stayed in a guest house close to the Mount Lavinia beach on the 1st of January and we were advised by the host to just walk few meters and find a beachfront restaurant. The closest restaurant was packed and we walked few more meters...and located Jo Jo‚Äôs bar/restaurant. It was also full, but the nice waiters brought a table and chairs for us to be very close to water.

It was the full moon and the moonlit beach and festive atmosphere‚Äîfamilies frolicking in water and occasional fireworks flying over the ocean‚Äîmade it a very special evening. 
Humorously, they did not serve beer because full moon was a religious holiday, but they did not mind opening a bottle of wine for us. The food we ordered‚Äîdeviled fish, kotthu, fish & chips & kankung‚Äîalso tasted very good. 

All in all, it was a great evening at Jo Jo and located Jo Jo‚Äôs bar/restaurant. It was also full, but the nice waiters brought a table and chairs for us to be very close to water.

All in all, it was a great evening at Jo Jo‚Äôs.
One of the best places i have tasted tiramisu as desert, food also tasty .. think their closed now , not sure where their are located now

Homily and set in plenty corners to escape to with a high dose of privacy to boot and the prices quite alright.
Superb ambiance .
We had good time with friends. Food order took a bit time.  Coffee was strong and tasty. Chocolate brownie was fresh and delicious.

We dropped there for Breakfast and we all ordered Breakfast Healthy Option . As per the Menu it was 3 Egg Omelette with Peppers, Mushroom, Baked Beans and Toast. 
Our surprise we got Omelette, Baked Beans and  Toast. 
When I asked the server then he...promptly said sir peppers mean back pepper and Mushroom Chopped and in the Omelette . And we did not fined any Mushroom in the Omelette .
So I felt this is Cheating or Server would have told something to come out from the issue. 
We decided to not to have this opti promptly said sir peppers mean back pepper and Mushroom Chopped and in the Omelette . And we did not fined any Mushroom in the Omelette .
So I felt this is Cheating or Server would have told something to come out from the issue. 
We decided to not to have this option.
It is a finest place for visit. You can visit their with your family, friends or solo. Very clean and tidy place. Love the coffees that they offered.

I've been to Toby's few times and satisfied with their food and became a returning customer. Very recently I visited them at around 10.30 in the night for a take away. However their kitchen was about to close and they were not taking any more...orders. We were bit stuck and didn't want to go for another restaurant as we were tired. After having a chat we came outside and were about to leave the place. At that point the manager came to our car by himself and asked us to get down and come inside. He said thst they will take our order. I asked if we were giving them trouble but he said no let us take the order. And we did and were relieved since our time was saved by him. 

The way he handled our order was going for the extra mile. The way he ensured that whatever the order is without knowing that in advance, will be provided to us is fantastic. It may have given some extra trouble to his chefs but he made sure a customer is treated well beyond expected level and he did his best to retain us for the next time as well. 

I'm not sure the rest of the staff is well trained for being proactive but this gentleman is fantast orders. We were bit stuck and didn't want to go for another restaurant as we were tired. nice place to have breakfast or just coffee with friends) big outdoor area) good prices and quite big menu
Toby‚Äôs is a super chilled out cafe. The prices of the cafe is also reasonable and no taxes or service charges. I highly recommend their Nasi Goreng & cappuccino.

This place used to be ok but gradually gone downhill.
My wife and I went there yesterday and I ordered a burger........not available.So I ordered a hot dog............not available.
What's the point of having items on the menu that are not available?
A frequent visitor with guests. The menu options are very reasonable in both price and size. I enjoy the ambience and service!
been there with friends. a pretty little joint with classy food and service..a great place to cement bonds and mend fences ..

This is a quiet location and a wonderful place to spend an evening with close friends. 
My baby shower was held here and I will never forget this place.

We went a few times for coffee and meals. The food was quite okay. Coffee tasted good. Service was mediocre. We found it difficult to find a suitable place to sit because the management had closed off an entire room, and not because it was...reserv reserved.

My Favourite place for Breakfast and Coffee. 
Pooja is the Best server and Chef Kalum is always appear to have a quick chit chat and to bid farewell .

Visited TE for lunch. we were set up in a private dining area which had an A/C that was not working! Apparently 1 large portion of their fried rice is enough for 3 people(according to the waiter) so we ordered 2 since there were 5...people.all 5 of them ended up eating just 1 portion,while the other portion remained untouched!(such a waste of food & money)! another friend ordered a garlic bread(that was really old,dry & hard as rock) with a portion of batter fried calamari(bland,no seasoning). I ordered a fish & chips,the portion of french fries was sufficient but the fish was a major let down.yet again no seasoning at all! the fish was really old & slimy & showed signs of being stored in the freezer way too long and not thawed properly(hence the reason for becoming slimy).
ordered a few drinks as well,every drink had way too much sugar syrup!
need to work on the quality & portion control.
and you might want to get that A/C fixed as we people.all 5 of them ended up eating just 1 portion,while the other portion remained untouched!(such a waste of food & money)! another friend ordered a garlic bread(that was really old,dry & hard as rock) with a portion of batter fried calamari(bland,no seasoning). need to work on the quality & portion control.
